a-1.etymology: pierwiastek wykrzyknika + łacińska mała litera A; pierwiastek z wykrzyknika (!) bez kropki na dole. porównaj o

a-3.commentary: This is likely not the earliest instance of this glyph, but there is no known earlier one.

akesi-1.etymology: animal radical; pictogram of a lizard. radical represents eyes

akesi-2.commentary: This glyph was created independently by many people. At the earliest, it appears in linja sike's first beta, but there it is not an independent glyph- it can only be accessed by stacking akesi with another glyph.

ala-1.etymology: znak X, znak negacji w wielu językach

anpa-1.etymology: location radical + "container"; the latter perhaps from a truncated square for a general object (compare sinpin) or a container (compare poki). for the radical, see also how dots are used in blissymbols; compare blissymbol "below"

ante-1.etymology: perhaps alteration from sama, or a combination of sama and ala. perhaps an ideogram representing a diversion of two lines

awen-1.etymology: pierwiastek ruchu; nogi odwrócone od siebie, co wskazuje na stanie

epiku-1.commentary: The earlier version of this glyph by TheDarkBomber more closely resembles the design of Reddit's upvote, but that design was replaced by the thinner design.

esun-1.etymology: nie od symbolu waluty (potwierdzone przez Sonję; powiedziała "sądzę, że to jest z języka mikmak", nie można jednak było znaleźć podobnego symbolu w mikmaku).

ike-1.etymology: pictogram of a frowning mouth. compare pona

jami-1.commentary: This glyph went through a few revisions before this version created by jan Sa and lipamanka. For example: https://discord.com/channels/301377942062366741/301377942062366741/743016537845399562

jan-1.etymology: head radical; pictogram of a person showing the shoulders

jo-1.etymology: perhaps a pictogram of a person pointing at themself or holding something

kala-2.commentary: The given earliest known glyph is somewhat silly, but it is an apt and intentional representation of the kala glyph with eyes.

kama-1.etymology: pierwiastek ruchu; nogi skierowane w lewo. Porównaj tawa i symbol Blissa "chodzić"

kamalawala-1.etymology: A wpisane w okrąg, symbol anarchii

kapesi-1.commentary: The earliest known version of this glyph has an overlapping triangle and circle. This is not considered a problem, as this minor variation is only distinguished by the various glyphs for olin.

ken-1.etymology: być może od łacińskiej litery K

kokosila-2.commentary: It is not currently known whether this glyph was created by jan Same or if it was taken from a prior reference.

kon-1.etymology: ideogram; linie faliste oznaczają płynność gazu. Porównaj telo

konwe-1.commentary: This glyph has been independently created a few times; the currently known earliest instance is likely not the earliest, especially based on the followin conversation: https://discord.com/channels/948448338662010910/1191946786936459325/1294891407026159647
konwe-1.etymology: piktogram działa w grze w życie Conwaya, maszyna poruszająca się po planszy.

ku-1.etymology: piktogram okładki słownika "Toki Pona Dictionary", przedstawiającej kurtkę z łatką wyglądającą jak logo toki pony.

kule-1.etymology: pierwiastek koloru; linia pozioma być może oznacza "samo pojęcie". Lub być może piktogram światła przechodzącego przez pryzmat (pierwiastek koloru)

kulijo-1.commentary: jan Lepeka reports to have created the lete version of kulijo, but we have not found the source. https://discord.com/channels/948448338662010910/1191946786936459325/1294891407026159647

kulupu-1.etymology: piktogram grupy złożonej z trzech członków reprezentowanych przez okręgi

la-1.etymology: perhaps related to blissymbol “later” and “ago”, or perhaps a parenthesis

lanpan-2.commentary: The flipped pana version of lanpan is likely older than currently known.

lanpan-3.commentary: The 'mistake' version of lanpan is named such at least two independent authors of it misinterpreted somebody else's handwriting, taking the tiny unclosed loop to be an intentional feature of the glyph.

lape-2.commentary: An earliest instance of this glyph exists primarily by coincidence. It does depict the lape glyph, but the intention of the author seems to be to draw a face on the mu glyph, as opposed to representing the word lape with a new glyph. https://discord.com/channels/301377942062366741/301377942062366741/811689197504823306

lawa-1.etymology: pierwiastek głowy; linia pozioma być może z tego samego powodu, co kule. Alternatywnie: piktogram osoby noszącej czapkę

lili-1.etymology: ideogram pokazujący rozmiar mniejszy w porównaniu z suli

lipu-1.etymology: piktogram kartki papieru. Porównaj symbol Blissa "papier"

lon-1.etymology: location radical above a line. compare blissymbol “over”

lupa-1.etymology: pictogram of a concave surface. compare nena

mama-1.etymology: pierwiastek głowy; mniejszy okrąg być może jest symbolem dziecka

mani-1.etymology: piktogram dużego zwierzęcia gospodarskiego, na przykład krowy (potwierdzone przez Sonję)

meli-2.commentary: This glyph has been independently recreated several times. For example, it was added to ijo Mina's linja suwi as 'meli-alt' in February 2021. https://web.archive.org/web/20210211124101/https://linjasuwi.ap5.dev/

mi-1.etymology: być może ręka wskazująca na mówcę. Porównaj sina i ona

mije-1.etymology: head radical with perhaps wide shoulders. compare jan

mije-2.commentary: This glyph has been independently recreated several times. For example, it was added to ijo Mina's linja suwi as 'mije-alt' in February 2021. https://web.archive.org/web/20210211124101/https://linjasuwi.ap5.dev/

moli-1.etymology: pierwiastek głowy; martwa osoba, oznaczona przez skreślone oczy

monsuta-1.etymology: visual representation of shaking as seen in cartoons

musi-1.etymology: perhaps a pictogram of a smile with rosy cheeks or a lyre

mute-1.etymology: ideogram składający się z trzech kresek. Porównaj wan i tu

mute-2.commentary: This was created as a ligature in Nishiki Teki on 11-02-2022, but not acknowledged as a "mute" glyph until Sonja posted it on 01-01-2024 and explicitly called such on 01-17-2024.

nasa-1.etymology: perhaps spiral representing “dizziness”, as can be commonly seen in Japanese manga and anime

nasin-1.etymology: ideogram składający się ze strzałki wzdłuż linii pionowej

nena-1.etymology: pictogram of a convex surface. compare lupa

ni-2.commentary: The original source is an ASCII rendering of the glyph, and referenced as "eni".  The contraction "eni" was only used a few dozen times in total, but the right-arrow rendering of ni remained and was added to linja sike 5 on 2021-08-31.

ni-3.commentary: The source of the glyph references it as both 'epiku' and 'turned ni'.

ni-4.commentary: It is likely that left ni was derived earlier, as the idea of 'ni' pointing any direction has developed independently several times. Some mentions of earlier sightings exist, such as here: https://discord.com/channels/301377942062366741/876636350214979614/928536305028169769

nimi-1.etymology: perhaps a pictogram of a nametag or sitelen pona cartouche

o-1.etymology: pierwiastek wykrzyknienia + mała łacińska litera O. porównaj a

olin-1.etymology: two heart symbols (♡), perhaps to distinguish from pilin.

olin-2.etymology: two heart symbols (♡), perhaps to distinguish from pilin.

ona-1.etymology: być może ręka wskazująca w bok. Porównaj mi i sina

open-1.etymology: perhaps a pictogram of an opened container

pan-1.etymology: perhaps a pictogram of a grain crop

penpo-1.etymology: toki-pona z promieniami na wszystkie strony

pika-1.commentary: The earliest known instance of this glyph is by nimi Elemenopi, but it was called linluwi and not pika. It is not known where this glyph came to be called pika, but it is believed that this glyph developed independently from other abstract representations of electricity. https://www.reddit.com/r/tokipona/comments/hxzvew

pimeja-1.etymology: pierwiastek koloru; krzyż być może oznacza brak światła

pipi-1.etymology: animal radical; pictogram of a bug

pu-1.etymology: piktogram okładki książki "Toki Pona: The Language of Good". Alternatywnie złożony znak semantyczny lipu i toki pona

sama-1.etymology: od znaku równości (=). Porównaj symbol Blissa "taki sam"

san-1.commentary: This glyph for san may have been developed independently multiple times.

seli-1.etymology: perhaps a pictogram of a lit campfire or a simplified pictogram of a fire

seme-1.etymology: od znaku zapytania (?). Porównaj symbol Blissa "co"

sijelo-1.etymology: perhaps a pictogram of a torso

sike-1.etymology: two circles, perhaps to distinguish from ijo. alternatively outline of a thick empty circle

sina-1.etymology: perhaps a hand pointing towards the listener. compare mi and ona

sitelen-1.etymology: perhaps a representation of symbols on a piece of paper (lipu)

soko-1.commentary: Despite thin stem soko being the more popular rendering of soko through at least February 2024, the primary glyph for soko is annulus soko as determined by the Unicode project.

soko-3.commentary: Despite thin stem soko being the more popular rendering of soko through at least February 2024, the primary glyph for soko is annulus soko as determined by the Unicode project.

su-1.etymology: piktogram okładki ilustrowanej książki z opowiadaniem "Czarnoksiężnik z Krainy Oz", przedstawiający obecną w historyjce drogę brukowaną żółtą kostką

suli-1.etymology: ideogram pokazujący większy rozmiar w porównaniu z lili

tan-1.etymology: a leaping arrow pointing from right to left, implying derivation or cause

tawa-1.etymology: pierwiastek ruchu, nogi zwrócone w prawo. Porównaj kama i symbol Blissa "chodzić"

tenpo-2.commentary: https://discord.com/channels/301377942062366741/340307145373253642/798480104237039636 earlier instance of the glyph but for "ten" , 01/12/2021

tu-1.etymology: two tally marks. compare mute and wan

unpa-1.etymology: być może od symbolu serca (szczególnie widoczne z pierwotnego rysunku znaku), lub wzór węzła oznaczający stosunek, lub być może piktogram narządów rozrodczych

usawi-1.commentary: The glyph 'nasa with emitters' was created on 2020-03-24 by jan Tumu, but the glyph would not be called usawi until independently created by jan Seli in 2021. https://discord.com/channels/301377942062366741/375591429608570881/692078503151009892

uta-2.commentary: jan Misali's "sitelen pona tan pu" font from 2016-09-06 depicts dotless uta. However, it is not considered the source of dotless uta today, as the font was and is essentially unknown, having only 11 downloads as of March 2025. Access the font here: https://fontstruct.com/fontstructions/show/1315854/sitelen-pona-tan-pu

utala-1.etymology: być może od symbolu skrzyżowanych mieczy (⚔️)

walo-1.etymology: color radical; perhaps the reverse of pimeja, the color radical cutting of the cross instead of vice versa

wan-1.etymology: jedna kreska lub indo-arabska cyfra 1, być może w celu jej odróżnienia

waso-1.etymology: animal radical; pictogram of a bird

wawa-1.etymology: perhaps a pictogram of a person with raised arms, to signify strength

weka-1.etymology: “poof lines”; indicating the movement of something disappearing

wile-1.etymology: być może od łacińskiej litery W
